title: PBE Hecarim Nerfs
body: How do you think these lastest nerfs will affect Hecarim? Should I continue to play the pony as my main top or move on to Irelia, Fiora and Gangplank?

replies.body:
The nerf isn't really that bad. Minion pathing will be a little annoying to deal with on him, but that's about it. You'll have to see how the Hecarim changes effect you personally, before deciding on switching mains for a while.

Just for the record though, if you're just looking for OP champions to main then **Gangplank **and **Fiora** are very average right now. Neither of them is any higher than 50% winrate, and they are super hard to play. They fell out of favor about 3 patches ago.

You're much better of going for one of the following actually OP champions:

{{champion:54}} **Malphite: **Super OP this meta, no counters or nerfs in the foreseeable future.
{{champion:24}}** Jax:** Still no real nerf on Guinsoo's next patch, to the OP will continue
{{champion:77}} **Udyr:** Same as Jax
{{champion:39}}** Irelia:** ^^
{{champion:23}} **Tryndamere:** Crit mastery is still awesome on him.
{{champion:36}} **Dr. Mundo:** Careful with this one, he's being nerfed in 5.24. I still think he's still going to be OP, but you never know.

mundo  isn't getting nerfed what so ever... pretty sure a max damage cap on q held at 500 for jg creeps and changing e total stale by -0.5% scale till rank 5 does do much... (eg, q 500 from 700 damage and e 17.5% scale rank 2 from 18%)
Thanks for advice! It's not that i think Gangplank and Fiora are op or not its just that I play them along with Hec and was wondering if the nerf was that substantial.

You should play champs you like and just get good with them instead of relying on what champs are 'op' or 'nerfed' 

A person who plays Zac all the time regardless of nerf or buff should always beat someone who just plays Lee/lee/trynd just because they are strong right now.
I haven't seen the nerfs yet, but, I'll tell you now, Rageblade Irelia is op
